tool.name: SAGA.ta_hydrology.6
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayELEVATION False isArraySEED False output_data_LENGTH $output_data_LENGTH name SAGA.ta_hydrology.6 ELEVATION $ELEVATION SEED $SEED SEEDS_ONLY $SEEDS_ONLY METHOD $METHOD CONVERGENCE $CONVERGENCE prefer $prefer response $response outputType_LENGTH $OutputSection_LENGTH.outputType_LENGTH transmissionMode_LENGTH $OutputSection_LENGTH.transmissionMode_LENGTH

param.name: ELEVATION
param.label: Elevation
param.help: Elevation The following data types are allowed in the txt file: png, x-ogc-envi, x-ogc-aaigrid, tiff

param.name: SEED
param.label: Seeds
param.help: Seeds The following data types are allowed in the txt file: png, x-ogc-envi, x-ogc-aaigrid, tiff

param.name: SEEDS_ONLY
param.label: Seeds Only
param.help: Use only seed cells as starting points.

param.name: CONVERGENCE
param.label: Convergence (FD8)
param.help: Convergence factor for the 'Multiple Flow Direction' algorithm (after Freeman 1991)

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_LENGTH
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format and the output value

tool.help: This tool calculates the average flow path length starting from the seeds, that are given by the optional 'Seeds' grid and optionally from cells without upslope contributing areas (i.e. summits, ridges). Seeds will be all grid cells, that are not 'no data' values. If seeds are not given, only summits and ridges as given by the flow routing will be taken into account. Available flow routing methods are based on the 'Deterministic 8 (D8)' (Callaghan and Mark 1984) and the 'Multiple Flow Direction (FD8)' (Freeman 1991, Quinn et al. 1991) algorithms.
